greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of prime divisors of -1 + (product of first n primes).
link: Amiram Eldar, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..99
Hisanori Mishima, Factorizations of many number sequences
R. G. Wilson v, Explicit factorizations
mathematica: a[q_] := Module[{x, n}, x=FactorInteger[Product[Table[Prime[i], {i, q}][[j]], {j, q}]-1]; n=Length[x]; Sum[Table[x[[i]][[2]], {i, n}][[j]], {j, n}]]
results.author: Arne Ring (arne.ring(AT)epost.de), May 30 2000
ext: More terms from _Robert G. Wilson v_, Mar 24 2001
a(42)-a(81) from _Charles R Greathouse IV_, May 07, 2011
